events.event_name: Czech National Bank Interest Rate Decision
events.description: The Czech National Bank kept its two-week repo rate unchanged at 3.5% in February 2026.

facts.fact_text: The Czech National Bank maintained the two-week repo rate at 3.5% in February 2026.

evidences.evidence_text: The Czech National Bank kept its two-week repo rate unchanged at 3.5% in February 2026, as widely anticipated, maintaining the level seen since May 2025.

facts.fact_text: Headline inflation in the Czech Republic fell to 1.6% in January.

evidences.evidence_text: headline inflation eased more than expected to a nine-year low of 1.6% in January, down from 2.1% in December
closely monitored services inflation remained elevated at 4.7%.

claims.claim_text: Domestic risks such as budget deficits and rising costs are preventing further monetary easing.
claims.author: Czech National Bank Policymakers

evidences.evidence_text: Policymakers have repeatedly cited domestic risks, including the budget deficit, rapidly rising service and housing costs, and wage growth, as obstacles to further monetary easing.

claims.claim_text: There may be room for interest rate cuts later in 2026 if inflation continues to ease.

evidences.evidence_text: Czech policymakers may have scope to cut rates this year, though further evidence of easing inflationary pressures will be needed to justify such a move.

evidence.evidence_text: Policymakers have repeatedly cited domestic risks... as obstacles to further monetary easing.
closely monitored services inflation remained elevated at 4.7%.
further evidence of easing inflationary pressures will be needed to justify such a move.
